question.title: RenderLayer.getTranslucent() in fabric 1.21.1 overrides/hides the block breaking animation
question.body:
I want do add a block to minecraft 1.21.1 with fabric that is partially transparent. While testing I found out, that the braking animation (cracks on the block) is missing. I later found out, that the following line is the problem (details below):

In onInitializeClient():

BlockRenderLayerMap.INSTANCE.putBlock(DreamBlocks.CottonCandyBlock, RenderLayer.getTranslucent());

Here is the rest of my code:

In DreamBlocks class:

public static final Block CottonCandyBlock = register(
        new Block(AbstractBlock.Settings.copy(Blocks.GLASS).sounds(BlockSoundGroup.WOOL).strength(0.8f, 0.8f).nonOpaque()),
        "cotton_candy_block",
        true
);

To my initiallize I added:

ItemGroupEvents.modifyEntriesEvent(ItemGroups.BUILDING_BLOCKS).register((itemGroup) -> {
    // Some other blocks...
    itemGroup.add(CottonCandyBlock.asItem());
});

To assets/dream-dimensions/blockstates I added the file cotton_candy_block.json:

{
  "variants": {
    "": { "model": "dream-dimensions:block/cotton_candy_block" }
  }
}

To assets/dream-dimensions/models/block I added the file cotton_candy_block.json:

{
  "parent": "block/cube_all",
  "textures": {
    "all": "dream-dimensions:block/cotton_candy_block"
  }
}

Of couse I also added the texture with alpha channel, an item model, a loot table and a translation.

I tried removing the other mods I always use (sodium, etc.) which didnt help. To confirm that the problem is caused by the specified line, I comented out, which resulted in a non transparent block, with a working breaking animation.

Has anyone of you had the same problem or any idea on how to solve it? If it helps, i can set the GitHub repo to public.

Edit: The animation is only visible when looking through the block with no other block behind it and also then very hard to see.
